column1: The complement system is a crucial part of the immune defense
It is activated through several pathways, including the classical, lectin, and alternative pathways
Upon activation, the complement system enhances the ability of antibodies to bind to pathogens
This binding can lead to the opsonization of pathogens, marking them for destruction by phagocytes
Additionally, the system can directly induce cell lysis, killing the pathogen
The complement system also supports inflammation, attracting immune cells to the site of infection
In contrast, if not regulated properly, the system can cause damage to healthy cells
Overall, the complement system plays a vital role in eliminating pathogens and initiating immune responses
Understanding its activation and roles is essential for comprehending immune defense mechanisms
